title:
Using Waystar Holding Corp.’s Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2024, compute the following in one response:
 
 Non-GAAP operating performance bridge (2024): Reconcile GAAP operating income (loss) to Adjusted EBITDA by explicitly listing and summing all add-backs the company includes (e.g., D&A, share-based compensation, restructuring/transaction/IPO costs, impairment, etc.). Report Adjusted EBITDA margin in % (2 decimals).
 
 CFO before working capital (2024): From the cash flow statement reconciliation, compute Net cash provided by operating activities + (increase)/decrease in net working capital. Report the resulting CFO before WC in $M (2 decimals) and as % of revenue (2 decimals).
 
 Free cash flow & conversion (2024): FCF = CFO − Purchases of property and equipment (treat capex outflows as positive). Report FCF in $M (2 decimals) and FCF/Revenue in % (2 decimals).
 
 Rounding & units: All $ amounts in USD $M with strict trailing zeros to 2 decimals; percentages to 2 decimals with %; ratios in x to 2 decimals. Cite the exact 10-K sections you pull from (e.g., Item 7 MD&A, Item 8 statements, non-GAAP reconciliations, debt footnote, RPO/deferred revenue disclosures).
description:
AT first looking at the WAY 10-K Item 8, Consolidated Statements of Operations, build the 2024 Non-GAAP operating performance bridge from GAAP operating income to Adjusted EBITDA and compute margin. Do this by, pulling GAAP operating income and revenue: Operating income (loss from operations) = $123.73M; Revenue = $943.55M. - List the company’s 2024 Adjusted EBITDA add-backs (per the 10-K reconciliation) and convert to $M with 2 decimals: For Depreciation & amortization: $186.63M. This can be found in Item 7 MD&A, Non‑GAAP financial measures—Adjusted EBITDA reconciliation. For Stock‑based compensation: $54.44M. For Acquisition & integration costs: $0.86M. For Costs related to amended debt agreements: $14.14M. For IPO‑related costs: $2.14M. Fror Asset & lease impairments: $0.00M For Other (lease‑related relocation costs): $1.57M. 
 Then, Sum to Adjusted EBITDA and compute margin:
 Adjusted EBITDA = $123.73M + $186.63M + $54.44M + $0.86M + $14.14M + $2.14M + $1.57M = $383.50M 
  Adjusted EBITDA margin = $383.50M ÷ $943.55M = 40.64%
 
 2) Compute 2024 CFO before working capital as Net cash provided by operating activities plus (increase)/decrease in net working capital, and express as % of revenue.
 - Net cash provided by operating activities (CFO) = $169.77M. [Item 8, Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows, 2024 Form 10‑K].
 - Sum 2024 “Changes in:” operating assets and liabilities (working capital) from the cash flow statement:
  • Accounts receivable: $(21.82)M. [Item 8, CFS—Changes in accounts receivable, 2024 Form 10‑K].
  • Income tax refundable: $3.97M. [Item 8, CFS—Income tax refundable, 2024 Form 10‑K].
  • Prepaid expenses and other current assets: $(2.32)M. [Item 8, CFS—Prepaid and other current assets, 2024 Form 10‑K].
  • Deferred costs: $(16.50)M. [Item 8, CFS—Deferred costs, 2024 Form 10‑K].
  • Other long‑term assets: $(0.47)M. [Item 8, CFS—Other long‑term assets, 2024 Form 10‑K].
  • Accounts payable and accrued expenses: $18.23M. [Item 8, CFS—Accounts payable and accrued expenses, 2024 Form 10‑K].
  • Deferred revenue: $(0.84)M. [Item 8, CFS—Deferred revenue, 2024 Form 10‑K].
  • Operating lease ROU assets and lease liabilities: $(0.42)M. [Item 8, CFS—Operating lease ROU assets and lease liabilities, 2024 Form 10‑K].
  • Other long‑term liabilities: $0.00M. [Item 8, CFS—Other long‑term liabilities, 2024 Form 10‑K].
 - Net working capital change (sum of “Changes in:” lines) = $(20.17)M; therefore CFO before WC = $169.77M + $20.17M = $189.94M. [Item 8, Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows, 2024 Form 10‑K].
 - CFO before WC as % of revenue = $189.94M ÷ $943.55M = 20.13%. [Item 8, Statements of Operations and Statements of Cash Flows, 2024 Form 10‑K].
 
 3) Compute 2024 Free Cash Flow (FCF) and FCF/Revenue using capex from the 10-K investing cash flows.
 - The 10‑K combines “Purchase of property and equipment and capitalization of internally developed software costs” into one line item; the standalone “purchases of property and equipment” amount is not separately disclosed. Use the combined line as capex for FCF. 2024 amount = $27.27M (cash outflow). [Item 8, Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows—Investing activities, 2024 Form 10‑K].
 - FCF = CFO − Purchases of property and equipment = $169.77M − $27.27M = $142.50M. [Item 8, Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows, 2024 Form 10‑K].
 - FCF/Revenue = $142.50M ÷ $943.55M = 15.10%. [Item 8, Statements of Operations and Statements of Cash Flows, 2024 Form 10‑K].
answer:
$383.50M; 40.64% (Item 8, Consolidated Statements of Operations; Item 7 MD&A, Non‑GAAP reconciliation). 
 
 $189.905M; 20.13% (Item 8, Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows; Item 8, Statements of Operations)
 
 $142.50M; 15.10% (Item 8, Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows—investing activities; Item 8, Statements of Operations).

rubric.criteria: Costs related to amended debt agreements = $14.14M
Net cash provided by operating activities (CFO) = $169.77M
Change in prepaid expenses and other current assets = $(2.32)M
Change in accounts payable and accrued expenses = $18.23M
Change in operating lease ROU assets and lease liabilities = $(0.42)M
Net working capital change (sum of changes) = $(20.17)M
CFO before working capital as % of revenue = 20.13%
Purchases of property and equipment (capex combined line) = $27.27M
Answer cites Item 7 MD&A, Non‑GAAP financial measures—Adjusted EBITDA reconciliation for adjusted EBITDA add-backs
Answer cites Item 8 Consolidated Statements of Operations for GAAP operating income and revenue
Answer cites Item 8 Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows (including investing activities) for CFO, working capital changes, and capex
